subject: Re: [PATCH v4 1/2] mm/memory_hotplug: Add support to accept memory during hot-add

reviews.author: Pratik Sampat (author)
reviews.summary: Reviewer Pratik Sampat raised concerns about how to handle unaccepted memory bitmap for hotplugged ranges, suggesting that it only covers initial boot memory and not hotpluggable ranges.
sentiment_signals: piggyback off an existing type or create a new one

reviews.author: Kiryl Shutsemau
reviews.summary: Reviewer Kiryl Shutsemau raised concerns about the patch's handling of unaccepted memory during hot-add, specifically pointing out that the current implementation may lead to crashes if memory accept is required but no table is allocated. He suggested declaring unaccepted hotpluggable ranges upfront in the EFI memory map as a better design approach.

reviews.author: David (arm)
reviews.summary: Reviewer David (arm) expressed concerns about the patch's implementation, calling it 'hacky' and suggesting a more generic approach to accepting hotplugged memory.
